# Space Law Funky Station operates under space law. All crew, passengers, and visitors aboard the station are expected to know and follow these laws (they are fairly common sense, only security and the captain need to know the times).
## Treatment Of Prisoners
Prisoners still have certain rights that must be upheld by law enforcement:
- Prisoners must be granted medical care if they are in a critical state, actively dying, or dead. Otherwise, it is not required to give prisoners medical care. - Prisoners must be granted food and water on request, unless they have proven themselves to not be deserving of it by being excessively antagonistic to Security staff. - Physical force is permitted against prisoners in the case that they are being disruptive or verbally combative (e.g. badmouthing officers, punching doors or other objects within the brig, or butchering clothes to make curtains.) This does not allow killing or otherwise maiming prisoners, unless said prisoners present a grave threat to life and limb. - Prisoners must be given their shift mandated PDA after confinement has finished. Unless there is solid proof of PDA tampering, in which case the PDA is to be secured and replaced with a fresh one. - Prisoners held for extended or permanent confinement should be held in the communal brig, and should not be confined to a solitary cell unless they pose a risk to life and limb.
### Restraints
This section covers the use of electropacks, muzzles, and handcuffs on prisoners and released criminals.
- The use of electropacks is authorized for prisoners and parolees that have been charged with Tier IV crimes or higher, pose a significant risk of escaping, and/or have been noted to be particularly violent - The use of muzzles is permitted for prisoners who are verbally antagonistic, or prisoners who have been proven to be practitioners of occult magic. - The use of handcuffs is authorized for prisoners who pose a threat to life and limb, and for the transferring of inmates to another location (such as a new cell, or to the evacuation shuttle). The use of handcuffs for prisoners is also authorized in the case that the brig becomes uninhabitable, however prisoners should be returned to the brig when possible.
## Searches
A personnel search is a seizure of the objects in a person's backpack, hands, coat, belt, pockets, and hat. If any contraband is found during a search the officer may choose to further the search into a detainment or simply confiscate the restricted items. After the search is conducted all legal items are to be returned to the person.
A crewmate may legally decline any search conducted without a warrant while the alert level is green. Should be noted that if the alert level is blue or above all personnel searches are legal and no longer require a warrant.
## Implantation
Any prisoner in custody can be subjected to implantation or implant removal procedures. The process of adding an implant should not prolong the detainees sentence, meaning you can not hold them longer to administer the implant, unless stated otherwise.
[bold]Loyalty Implants[/bold]: If a Tier III crime or above is committed, Loyalty Implants are authorized. For Tier IV, it is recommended. For Tier V, it is mandatory. If a suspect refuses to cooperate or the implant fails to function they can be charged with Refusal of Implantation.
Loyalty Implants are permitted below Tier III crimes with permission by both the Captain and Central Command, barring situations where command does not have time to contact Central Command.
[bold]Mindshield Implants[/bold]: Under normal circumstances, a crewmate can refuse a Mind Shield if they are not imprisoned for committing a crime.
[bold]However, when there is a known threat to the station that utilizes mass brainwashing or mind control, crewmates must submit to a Mind Shield if ordered by Security. Failure to comply is to be treated as Refusal of Mental Shielding.[/bold]
### Removal
A suspect can be forced to receive implant removal if permitted by either HoS or Captain.
## Sentencing All sentencing is to primarily be handled by the Warden, if no Warden is available the HoS is to take over that duty, if there's no HoS it falls onto the highest ranking member of Security.
Use common sense and humanity when issuing punishments. You should not always seek out the highest punishment you can, you don't have to always give the maximum time or always look to demote someone. Always take in account the severity and only charge for what is needed for someone to learn their lesson. However, please keep in mind that the point of punishments is to discipline disobedient staff. Do not allow crew members to feel comfortable breaking the law.
[bold]Accessory, Attempting, And Intention:[/bold] If someone intentionally, knowingly and substantially assists someone in enacting a crime they can be charged with the relevant crimes, such as an engineer giving someone tools, who says they are going to break into an area. Same goes for a clear and solid attempt at a crime, or a person who shows clear intent to act out a crime, such as a syndicate nuclear operative arming a nuke but getting arrested before it goes off, they can still be charged with terrorism. Does not apply to crimes that have an attempted listing already, like attempted murder.
[bold]Stackable Crimes:[/bold] Crimes are to be considered 'stackable' in the sense that if you charge someone with two or more different crimes, you should combine the times you would give them for each crime.
[bold]External Influences:[/bold] Crimes committed while under the mental control of another individual or entity are to be pardoned once a clear and successful deconversion occurs.
[bold]Executions:[/bold] Executions may be authorized by the Captain / acting Captain after a trial has been conducted. Executions may also be approved by CentComm, following formal contact.
# Repeat Offenses Offenses repeated again after having been detained for the same crime can have more time added to the recommended maximum sentencing. The general guideline is as follows:
## Second Offenses [bold]Recommended Increase:[/bold] Recommended to increase sentencing time by 2x.
## Third Offenses [bold]Recommended Increase:[/bold] Recommended to increase sentencing time by 3x alongside a loyalty implant.
## Further Repeat Offenders If the detainee as committed the same crime more than three times in separate occasions, it will be up to the Warden's, or in absence of a Warden, the highest ranking Security Member's discretion on whether they should be put into the Permanent Brig.
[bold]If brigtime goes above 20 minutes, perma is highly recommended.[/bold]
# Crimes
# I Degree
For minor crimes, fix the issue then warn the person to not attempt the crime again, if they still proceed to do it at a later date, a brig time may be better.
## Disturbance
[bold]Description[/bold]: To cause a public disturbance.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 2:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] Sometimes referred to as hooliganism. The catch-all for obnoxious crewmates. Covers things such as public nudity, needless insults, obstructing authorities, and inciting crime or violence.
## Petty Theft
[bold]Description[/bold]: To take non-vital or inexpensive property of another individual, organization, or common property, without consent.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 3:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] The difference between petty theft and grand theft is based on how crucial the stolen item is, things like instruments, clothing and tools fall under petty theft. In most cases all you need to do is detain the thief, return the stolen item and let them go with a warning.
## Possession/Use of Illegal Substances
[bold]Description[/bold]: To make, hold, or abuse restricted drugs or chemicals.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 3:00
[bold]Notes: This is to be followed in accordance with Standard Operating Procedure. If anything questionable is not brought up in SOP the captain or highest standing command staff may publicly restrict it.[/bold]
## Trespass
[bold]Description[/bold]: To enter a non-secured area without permission.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 2:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] It may be better to simply remove them from the area instead of detaining them.
## Vandalism
[bold]Description[/bold]: To intentionally deface or superficially damage public or private property.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 2:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] Painting graffiti, smashing bar glasses, and cracking internal windows is vandalism, breaking a window into space or secure areas is not.
## Wasting Company Time
[bold]Description[/bold]: To idle while work needs to be done, or to neglect one's duty to the corporation.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment[/bold]: 2:00
[bold]Notes[/bold]: Should usually be issued after a warning.
# II Degree
## Animal Cruelty
[bold]Description[/bold]: To inflict unnecessary suffering or harm on a non-sapient being with malicious intent.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 5:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] This doesn't include legitimate and authorized animal testing and usually doesn't extend to vermin or creatures that could pose a threat to the station.
## Damage/Destruction of Property
[bold]Description[/bold]: To maliciously damage or deface public or private property or equipment.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 4:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] Step up from vandalism but a step down from mass destruction.
## Endangerment
[bold]Description[/bold]: To recklessly put yourself or others in danger, either through direct action, or failure to act.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 4:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] Covers industrial accidents, industrial negligence, self-experimentation, or even medical malpractice.
## Failure to Comply
[bold]Description[/bold]: To resist reasonable orders given by an authority. This extends to warrants and authorized searches.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 2:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] The order has to be reasonable and the person has to receive a good amount of warning before the arrest is issued.
## Possession of Restricted Gear
[bold]Description[/bold]: To hold or use non-lethal items or objects that are restricted or illegal.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 5:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] This is mostly for syndicate contraband; EMAGs, syndicate gas masks, bloodred hardsuits, hijacked PDAs, or implants, however can sometimes extend to things the individual shouldn't possess like kevlar vests and security gear.
## Rioting
[bold]Description[/bold]: To take part in a large group of personnel creating an unlawful public disturbance.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 4:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] Crimes like damage of property or battery are expected to be thrown on top of this charge. Leaders of a riot can be charged with all crimes that happen under their lead.
## SOP Violation
[bold]Description[/bold]: To knowingly and willfully violate a department's standard operating procedure.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 5:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] Loyalty implant recommended upon repeated instances of a person being charged with this crime.
## Obstruction of Justice
[bold]Description[/bold]: To interfere with the process of justice.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 5:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] This includes actions like interfering with arrests, destroying or tampering with evidence, or lying to security officers.
# III Degree
## Assault/Battery
[bold]Description[/bold]: To threaten to or to use physical force against someone without the intent to kill.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 6:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] Attempted murder and battery are different, make sure you've got it right.
## Breach of Arrest
[bold]Description[/bold]: To intentionally resist and flee arrest or detainment by an authorized staff.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 4:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] This only applies if the person is actively being physically arrested. Includes people uncuffing or assisting others out of an arrest. Breach of custody is a separate crime.
## Grand Theft
[bold]Description[/bold]: To take critical or unreplaceable property of another individual or organization without consent.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 6:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] The difference between petty theft and grand theft is based on how crucial the stolen item is, this mostly is used for the theft of command staff items, things like door remotes, hardsuits, jetpacks, and unreplaceable machine parts.
## Manslaughter
[bold]Description[/bold]: To incidentally kill a sapient being without intent.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 10:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] Includes manslaughter in self-defense and negligent manslaughter.
## Mass Destruction
[bold]Description[/bold]: To cause massive damage to an area or major station system.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 15:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] This is mostly used for deadly bombings or sabotage of major station systems such as power production, cloning, substations, or atmos.
## Possession of Restricted Weaponry
[bold]Description[/bold]: To hold or use a weapon that is unlawful or contraband.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 6:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] Everything from guns without a permit, deadly blades, explosives, syndicate firearms to explosive implants.
## Secure Trespass
[bold]Description[/bold]: To enter a secured area without permission.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 8:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] This covers places like telecoms, head offices, security zones, command areas, the vault and armory.
## Breach of Custody
[bold]Description[/bold]: To break out of a cell or custody with the intention of escaping.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 5:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] This time should be added on top of a prisoners current brig time. While rare, this charge can be bumped to permanent brig if the suspect has attempted to escape from or assist another in escaping from the brig multiple times.
# IV Degree
## Attempted Murder
[bold]Description[/bold]: To make an attempt to use physical force against someone with the clear intent to kill.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 10:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] Make sure you've got the proof to back up the intention claims.
## Kidnapping
[bold]Description[/bold]: To unlawfully restrain, transport, control or confine a sapient being against that individual's will.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 10:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] A large range of things, used mostly as a catch-all when dealing with unlawful control of another being.
## Murder
[bold]Description[/bold]: To kill a sapient being with malicious intent.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] 10:00
[bold]Notes:[/bold] This only changes from attempted to full on murder if the victim enters a state of being deceased, having to be resurrected.
# V Degree
## Mass Murder
[bold]Description[/bold]: To kill three or more sapient beings with malicious intent.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] Permanent
[bold]Notes:[/bold] Only applies when there have been multiple killings with intention.
## Capital Negligence
[bold]Description[/bold]: To recklessly put yourself or others in danger, either through direct action, or failure to act as a command member.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] Permanent / Demotion
[bold]Notes:[/bold] This covers causing the death of one or more crewmates, failing to repair / mitigate severe station damage, or causing severe station damage. This charge is meant to be handed to Command members, and may be added to their permanent record.
## Prevention of Revival
[bold]Description[/bold]: To render a body unresurrectable.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] Permanent
[bold]Notes:[/bold] This covers gibbing, spacing, intentionally hiding a body leading to it rotting, or other ways of preventing a body with a soul from being resurrected.
## Refusal of Mental Shielding
[bold]Description[/bold]: To refuse to comply with a reasonable Mind Shielding procedure.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] Permanent
[bold]Notes:[/bold] Applies if the suspect is excessively uncooperative or the implant fails to function due to the mental state of the prisoner already being too far gone. If the implant fails the Recommended Maximum Punishment is upped to Expedited Execution.
## Treason
[bold]Description[/bold]: To commit acts that, by their nature, oppose the objectives of Command and by extension Nanotrasen itself.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] Execution
[bold]Notes:[/bold] This covers a wide range of crimes, and is meant to be more applicable than terrorism. For instance, anti-Command riots, high profile syndicate attacks, etc.
## Terrorism
[bold]Description[/bold]: To engage in maliciously destructive actions which threaten to destroy, or successfully destroy a vessel or habitat.
[bold]Recommended Maximum Punishment:[/bold] Execution
[bold]Notes:[/bold] Summed up; extreme sabotage of station systems or setting off self-destruction systems.
